name: woodpile
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a pile of wood that has been collected to be used as fuel: We walked round to the back of the house, passing the neatly stacked woodpile.
More examplesFewer examples In urban areas, skunks take refuge in brush piles, woodpiles and overgrown areas.He's still taking logs off last year's woodpile; it has been too warm to use the fireplace much.Should you be collecting timber from a woodpile, keep an eye out for small scorpions, which can deliver nasty but not life-threatening stings.Elevate woodpiles about 15 inches off the group to keep mice from burrowing.
